title: Guidelines - Replacing a Lost Smart Key

body.body: Guidelines - Replacing a Lost Smart Key

This instruction provides a brief outline of the process for pairing a replacement smart key, in the event that the original smart key has been lost. The instruction assumes the motorcycle is in its delivered condition, with one smart key and two passive keys paired.
Obtain all available motorcycle keys from the owner.
Power the motorcycle ON using one of the passive keys.
The pairing of the passive key used to power the motorcycle ON is retained.
The other two keys are registered as inactive.
Press the smart key button to lock the new smart key to the keyless ECM.
Pair the passive key that was NOT used to power the motorcycle ON.
The motorcycle now has two passive keys and the replacement smart key paired.

The original smart key is stored as an erased key in the keyless ECM memory. If the original smart key is later found, it can be paired and reactivated by following the ‘Adding a Second Smart Key’ procedure (see
Guidelines - Adding a Second Smart Key
